intro: Oenothera viridescens, commonly known as greenstem evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its slender, green stems and yellow flowers that bloom in the evening. The plant typically grows in dry, disturbed soils and is often found in prairies and open woodlands. Its flowers have four petals and are pollinated primarily by moths and other nocturnal insects. Oenothera viridescens is also noted for its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions and its role in supporting local pollinator populations.
